conclusion: Analyze the motion of the frame through the magnetic field to determine the time of induced current.
Identify parameters: side length \( l \), width \( d \), speed \( v \), and time \( t \).
Calculate time \( t = \frac{d}{v} \) for frame to move through the magnetic field.
Induced current occurs when magnetic flux changes as frame enters or exits the magnetic field.
Frame starts entering at \( x = 0 \) and exits at \( x = d \).
Frame fully inside magnetic field when \( 0 \leq x \leq l \); time \( t_{\text{in}} = \frac{l}{v} \).
Time for frame to move from \( x = l \) to \( x = d \) is \( t_{\text{out}} = \frac{d - l}{v} \).
Total time inside magnetic field \( t_{\text{total}} = \frac{d}{v} \).
